uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools
Class SimpleGeoData

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.SimpleGeoData
All Implemented Interfaces:
GeoData, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Raster, RemoteGeoData, TernaryGeoData
public class SimpleGeoData
extends java.lang.Object
implements GeoData, java.io.Serializable

A concrete implementation of the GeoData interface, it is suitable for most uses and may be extended for more specialist GeoData implementations.

Author:
James Macgill JM
See Also:
Serialized Form

          Constructs a SimpleGeoData by pulling the values from a Hashtable.
The hashtable should be built with Integer objects holding ids as keys and Double objects or strings for the values.

 double getMissingValueCode()
          Not all posible ids will have a value stored in the GeoData object, so when a call is made to getValue with an id that is not stored a special value is returned to signify that a value for this id is missing.
A call to this method will return the current code in use to represent that situation.

          All GeoData objects can have a name associated with them.
Typicaly the name will match the Column heading from which the data came from.
Names can be important when the GeoData is used in thematic maps as this is the name that will be placed in the key by default.

Constructor Detail

SimpleGeoData

public SimpleGeoData()
the default constructor for SimpleGeoData

SimpleGeoData

public SimpleGeoData(java.util.Hashtable h)
Constructs a SimpleGeoData by pulling the values from a Hashtable.
The hashtable should be built with Integer objects holding ids as keys and Double objects or strings for the values.
Parameters:
h - A hashtable containg the id keys and values for this SimpleGeoData object
Method Detail

doMinMax

public void doMinMax()
Updates the values for min and max that are returned by getMin and getMax.
This method iterates through all of the data stored to find the current Min and Max values.

setMissingValueCode

public void setMissingValueCode(double mv)
Not all posible ids will have a value stored in the GeoData object, so when a call is made to getValue with an id that is not stored a special value is returned to signify that a value for this id is missing.
By default that value is set to MISSING, however this behavoir can be changed by calling this method with a new value.
Specified by:
setMissingValueCode in interface GeoData
Parameters:
mv - A double containing the new value to represent missing data.
See Also:
getMissingValueCode()

getMissingValueCode

public double getMissingValueCode()
Not all posible ids will have a value stored in the GeoData object, so when a call is made to getValue with an id that is not stored a special value is returned to signify that a value for this id is missing.
A call to this method will return the current code in use to represent that situation.
Specified by:
getMissingValueCode in interface GeoData
Returns:
double The current value representing missing data.
See Also:
setMissingValueCode(double)

setValue

public double setValue(int id,
                       double value)
Stores the id/value pair into this GeoData.
If the id specifed already has a value associated with it then the old value is returned.
If the id is a new one then the returned value will match the current missingValueCode
Parameters:
id - An int holding the id to set the value for.
value - The value to associate with the specifed id.
Returns:
The old value associated with id, or missingValueCode if the id was previusly not set.

getMissingCount

public int getMissingCount()
Returns the number of values stored that equal the current missing value code.
Specified by:
getMissingCount in interface GeoData
Following copied from interface: uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.GeoData
Returns:
int The number of missing values stored in this GeoData.

setText

public java.lang.String setText(int id,
                                java.lang.String text)
Stores the id/text pair into this GeoData.
If the id specifed already has text associated with it then the old text is returned.
If the id is a new one then the returned String will be null
Parameters:
id - An int holding the id to set the value for.
text - The String to associate with the specifed id.
Returns:
The old text associated with id, or null if the id was previusly not set.

setName

public void setName(java.lang.String name_)
All GeoData objects can have a name associated with them.
Typicaly the name will match the Column heading from which the data came from.
Names can be important when the GeoData is used in thematic maps as this is the name that will be placed in the key by default.
Specified by:
setName in interface GeoData
Parameters:
name_ - The name to be associated with this GeoData.

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
All GeoData objects can have a name associated with them.
Typicaly the name will match the Column heading from which the data came from.
Names can be important when the GeoData is used in thematic maps as this is the name that will be placed in the key by default.
Specified by:
getName in interface GeoData
Returns:
String The name associated with this GeoData.

getValue

public double getValue(int id)
look up a value for the given id if the GeoData object is completly empty with no values set at all then it bounces the id back to the caller. this is an experimental new behavior for getValue
Specified by:
getValue in interface GeoData
Following copied from interface: uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.GeoData
Parameters:
id - An int specifying the feature id to retreve a value for.
Returns:
double The value for the specified id, if no id matches the one given then the value specifed by setMissingValue should be returned.
See Also:
#setMissingValue

getMin

public double getMin()
A quick statistic relating to the values stored in the GeoData object.
Specified by:
getMin in interface GeoData
Returns:
double The smallest value currently stored in this GeoData. The missingValueCode is not included in this test.

getMax

public double getMax()
A quick statistic relating to the values stored in the GeoData object.
Specified by:
getMax in interface GeoData
Returns:
double The largest value currently stored in this GeoData. The missingValueCode is not included in this test.

getSize

public int getSize()
The total number of stored id/value pairs stored in this GeoData.
Specified by:
getSize in interface GeoData
Returns:
int The number of values stored in this GeoData.

getText

public java.lang.String getText(int id)
Looks up and retreves a string for the specifed feature id.
Used for example by the ToolTip feature in Themes to provide tool tip text for each feature.
Specified by:
getText in interface GeoData
Parameters:
id - An int specifying the feature to retreve the text for.
Returns:
String A piece of text for the chosen feature id. If no id matches then an empty string should be returned " "

getIds

public java.util.Enumeration getIds()
In order to allow systems to iterate through all of the data contained within the GeoData object this method provides a list of all of the IDs which have associated values stored.
Specified by:
getIds in interface GeoData
Returns:
Enumeration An enumeration of all of the IDs which can then be iterated through.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns the name of the GeoData object. This can be handy when you want to include GeoData objets in lists.
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
Strin the name of this GeoData
